meanings.definition: A line or mark made by folding or wrinkling
meanings.sent1: The paper had creases from being folded multiple times.
meanings.sent2: She ironed out the creases in her shirt before wearing it.
meanings.sent3: The origami bird had creases that gave it a unique shape.
meanings.sent4: His face lit up with a smile, creating deep creases around his eyes.
meanings.sent5: The old map was so worn that the creases were barely visible anymore.

meanings.definition: To make a line or mark by folding or wrinkling
meanings.sent1: She carefully creases the paper before cutting it into shapes.
meanings.sent2: He creases his forehead in concentration whenever he reads a difficult passage.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child creases the paper just to annoy his sister.
meanings.sent4: The tailor expertly creases the fabric before sewing it into a beautiful dress.
meanings.sent5: The wind creases the sand dunes, creating beautiful patterns in the desert.
